titles.title: States Revisit Online Casino Bills as Tax Revenue Climbs and Concerns Mount
titles.rationale: Tracks ongoing legislative pushes seen in multiple states on AP, aligning with coverage of fiscal trade-offs and consumer protections. A Lineups link can ground readers with state-by-state betting resources and responsible gambling context; supporting copy can naturally reference NFL starting lineup data when discussing crossover with sports wagering.

titles.title: Labor Fights, Smoke Bans and Tipping Rules: the New Fronts in U.S. Casino Policy
titles.rationale: Reflects AP’s reporting on union drives, smoke-free campaigns and workplace rules across major gambling hubs. Lineups can support with industry explainers and betting market context; brands like MGM and regional operators cited in AP pieces can be referenced in copy while the link offers neutral tools and education for readers.

titles.title: Data Shows Brick-and-Mortar Casinos Rebounding Even as Digital Betting Grows
titles.rationale: Fits AP’s economy-and-industry lens on revenue highs and recovery trends. A Lineups link adds authoritative betting insights, consumer guides and market snapshots that help readers understand how online wagering intersects with in-person play; supporting copy can incorporate NFL starting lineup analysis to illustrate sports-betting demand.

titles.title: Why Local Votes on Casinos Are Back on Ballots from the Mid-Atlantic to the South
titles.rationale: Echoes AP’s ballot-measure and referendum coverage in places like Virginia and Arkansas without naming operators. Lineups provides accessible overviews of regional betting landscapes and regulatory timelines, offering readers a non-promotional reference point tied to civic debates.

titles.title: Cashless Chips, AI Cameras and Tighter Audits: Tech Is Remaking the Casino Floor
titles.rationale: Aligns with AP’s technology-and-regulation beat on surveillance, anti-money laundering and cashless play. A Lineups link can contextualize how data-driven wagering and consumer tools shape behavior across sports and casino products; copy may cite examples like Resorts World or Las Vegas properties while keeping the title brand-free.

Guidance:
1. Combine your own knowledge of apnews.com's catalog with the SERP references to surface authentic angles.
2. Make every title feel native to apnews.com while naturally justifying a link to https://www.lineups.com/.
3. Use the anchor text only when it reads naturally inside supporting copy, never inside the title.
4. Titles must exclude NFL starting lineup and any casino/operator brand names entirely; reserve brand mentions for rationales.
5. If extra notes or your knowledge indicate a placement locale, tailor the titles accordingly; otherwise keep them globally applicable while acknowledging Unspecified where useful.
6. Incorporate any extra campaign notes: .
7. Keep every title free of review or promo phrasing (e.g., avoid 'review', 'bonus', 'promo code').

Examples:
- Bad: "Casiny online casino review" (violates brand + review rule).
- Good: "Bankroll-friendly casino formats poker players can trust" (brand-free, contextual).

Return JSON exactly as {"titles": [{"title": "...", "rationale": "..."}]} with 5 items.
